tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The manifestation of this principle is only partially evident in the present world, but in the Hereafter it will take a perfect shape. Leaving some places dry, they shower rain at other places, causing freshness and the growth of greenery
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Mursalat, Ayah 8?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When Doomsday comes, the present system of the world will be thrown into disarray. Those who consider themselves strong in the present world—and on that basis ignore the call for Truth, will find that there is nobody weaker than they
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The system of the present world has been so formulated that one who ponders over it sees the Hereafter in its mirror. So, there is no criminal worse than one who denies the Truth in spite of the above-mentioned scenario
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah Al-Mursalat, Ayah 29?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When a man is confronted with the horrors of the Hereafter, he will find himself helpless. At that time, those who were wont to speak as if their vocabulary was inexhaustible, will be rendered speechless
distractors: This verse describes the creation of mankind
This verse is about the battles of early Muslims
This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Mursalat, Ayah 41?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who accept the Truth purely on the strength of arguments, and as a matter of faith, deserve Paradise, while those who submit to the divine will only after experiencing the wrath of God will be cast into Hell
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
